title: Ukraine war live: leaders of UK, France, Germany and Poland arrive in Kyiv to push for ceasefire
snippets:
The visit comes as the US warned of intelligence about a big impending air attack on Ukraine

It is Emmanuel Macron’s first visit to Kyiv since summer 2022, and the first visit as chancellor for Friedrich Merz, who only took office this week.

The four European leaders visited Kyiv’s Maidan on Saturday morning, together with Volodymyr Zelenskyy and his wife. Thousands of flags have been planted in the central square, to remember those who have been killed in the war with Russia. The leaders paid their respects and had a moment of silence, before heading to talks with Zelenskyy.

Continue reading...

Keir Starmer, Emmanuel Macron, Friedrich Merz and Donald Tusk arrive in Ukraine in show of support amid US intelligence warning of possible air attack

The leaders of Britain, France, Germany and Poland have arrived in Kyiv for a symbolic visit to Ukraine, one day after Vladimir Putin hosted a set-piece military parade on Red Square. The visit comes as the US warned of intelligence about a big impending air attack on Ukraine.

Keir Starmer, Emmanuel Macron, Friedrich Merz arrived in Kyiv on the same train on Saturday morning, while Donald Tusk travelled on a separate train. The four leaders met in the Polish city of Rzeszow on Friday night before departing. On Saturday, they will meet Ukraine’s president Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a show of support for Ukraine, Downing Street said in a statement issued late on Friday.

Continue reading...

The leaders of Britain, France, Germany and Poland have arrived in Kyiv for a symbolic visit to Ukraine, one day after Vladimir Putin hosted a set-piece military parade on Red Square. The visit comes as the US warned of intelligence about a big impending air attack on Ukraine.

Keir Starmer, Emmanuel Macron, Friedrich Merz arrived in Kyiv on the same train on Saturday morning, while Donald Tusk travelled on a separate train. The four leaders met in the Polish city of Rzeszow on Friday night before departing. On Saturday, they will meet Ukraine’s president Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a show of support for Ukraine, Downing Street said in a statement issued late on Friday.

Continue reading...
titles: Ukraine war live: leaders of UK, France, Germany and Poland arrive in Kyiv to push for ceasefire
Leaders of Britain, France, Germany and Poland arrive in Kyiv to push for 30-day ceasefire
Leaders of Britain, France, Germany and Poland arrive in Kyiv to push for 30-day ceasefire
summary: European leaders Emmanuel Macron, Friedrich Merz, Keir Starmer, and Donald Tusk visited Kyiv, Ukraine, in a show of support amidst US warnings of a potential large-scale air attack by Russia. This marks Macron's first visit since summer 2022 and Merz's first as chancellor. During their visit, they, along with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and his wife, paid tribute to war victims at Kyiv's Maidan. The visit follows a military parade in Russia, highlighting the tense situation. The leaders met in Rzeszow, Poland, before traveling to Ukraine to meet with President Zelenskyy.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about the ongoing conflict in Ukraine and the international response to it. It gives readers a deeper understanding of the situation and the key players involved. However, it does not report on specific solutions or improvements, and it does not provide a clear sense of agency for the reader.

title: Pakistan says it has struck Indian military bases in major escalation, as troop build-up reported at border – live updates
snippets:
‘Multiple locations’ in India being targeted in retaliatory attacks, says state-run media, after Pakistan says three air bases attacked by Indian missiles

  • Full report: Pakistan says it has hit back after India strikes military bases

Who is Asim Munir, the army chief leading Pakistan’s military amid the crisis with India?

The general once fell foul of Imran Khan, but since taking the top spot has been quietly amassing power over the government and supreme court, as our profile here says.

Yet even now that the country is out of the clutches of martial law, it is still widely understood that the most powerful man in Pakistan is not the head of the government but instead the chief of the army.

Since Gen Munir took over as Pakistan’s army chief more than two years ago, he has been accused of quietly consolidating greater power without even having to topple the country’s civilian rulers. As he kept himself largely out of the limelight, he consolidated an iron grip over the army’s ranks and bent government policy and even the supreme court to his will.

Continue reading...

title: Why did 30 Met officers kick the door down at a teenage tea and biscuits meeting in a Quaker house?
snippets:
When six young women hired a room to discuss the war in Gaza, the gathering ended with 30 officers storming in to make arrests

When six young women gathered in central London to discuss the climate crisis and the war in Gaza, the setting could not have been more appropriate. The building in which they sat was a Quaker meeting house, the home of a movement whose centuries-long history is rooted in protest and a commitment to social justice. On the table were cups of jasmine tea, ginger biscuits and a selection of vegan cheese straws.

But the events that brought this apparently convivial gathering to an abrupt end have sparked protests of a different kind and raised questions about how justice is administered by the UK’s largest and most embattled police force.

Continue reading...

When six young women hired a room to discuss the war in Gaza, the gathering ended with 30 officers storming in to make arrests

But the events that brought this apparently convivial gathering to an abrupt end have sparked protests of a different kind and raised questions about how justice is administered by the UK’s largest and most embattled police force.

Continue reading...
titles: Why did 30 Met officers kick the door down at a teenage tea and biscuits meeting in a Quaker house?
Why did 30 Met officers kick the door down at a teenage tea and biscuits meeting in a Quaker house?
summary: Six young women were arrested by 30 officers during a meeting at a Quaker house in central London, where they had gathered to discuss the climate crisis and the war in Gaza. The incident, which occurred in a setting known for its historical commitment to social justice and peaceful protest, has sparked further protests and raised significant concerns about the conduct of the UK's largest police force.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides a deeper understanding of a specific event and its implications for social justice and peaceful protest. It also increases awareness about the conduct of the UK's largest police force. However, it does not provide actionable insights or report on solutions to the problem.

title: New Light Trick in Carbon Nanotubes Could Boost Solar Power
snippets: RIKEN scientists have revealed how carbon nanotubes can emit light that’s more energetic than the light they absorb, thanks to phonon interactions and the formation of dark excitons. This could pave the way for breakthroughs in solar energy and futuristic photonic devices. Three physicists from Japan’s RIKEN Center for Advanced Photonics have uncovered how ultra-thin [...]
titles: New Light Trick in Carbon Nanotubes Could Boost Solar Power
summary: Scientists at Japan's RIKEN Center for Advanced Photonics have discovered that carbon nanotubes can emit light more energetic than the light they absorb due to phonon interactions and the formation of dark excitons. This finding could lead to significant advancements in solar power technology and the development of new photonic devices, enhancing the efficiency and capabilities of these technologies.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it reports on a scientific innovation that could lead to significant advancements in solar power technology. It provides useful insights into the potential impacts of this discovery and increases awareness about the capabilities of carbon nanotubes in the field of photonics.
